Detailed Description

An object used to create frame-by-frame animations, defined by a series of Drawer objects, which can be used as a Widget object's background.

The simplest way to create a frame-by-frame animation is to define the animation in an XML file, placed in the res/drawable/ folder, and set it as the background to a Widget object. Then, call start() to run the animation.

An AnimationDrawer defined in XML consists of a single <animation-list> element, and a series of nested <item> tags. Each item defines a frame of the animation. See the example below.

spin_animation.xml file in res/drawable/ folder: 

<!-- Animation frames are wheel0.png -- wheel5.png files inside the
 res/drawable/ folder -->
 <animation-list android:id="selected" android:oneshot="false">
    <item android:drawable="@drawable/wheel0" android:duration="50" />
    <item android:drawable="@drawable/wheel1" android:duration="50" />
    <item android:drawable="@drawable/wheel2" android:duration="50" />
    <item android:drawable="@drawable/wheel3" android:duration="50" />
    <item android:drawable="@drawable/wheel4" android:duration="50" />
    <item android:drawable="@drawable/wheel5" android:duration="50" />
 </animation-list>

Here is the code to load and play this animation.

void gaia::graphics::AnimationDrawer::setOneShot ( bool  oneShot)

Parameters:
oneShotPass true if the animation should only play once
bool gaia::graphics::AnimationDrawer::setVisible ( bool  visible,
bool  restart 
) [virtual]

Set whether this Drawer is visible.

This generally does not impact the Drawer's behavior, but is a hint that can be used by some Drawers, for example, to decide whether run animations.

Parameters:
visibleSet to true if visible, false if not.
restartYou can supply true here to force the drawer to behave as if it has just become visible, even if it had last been set visible. Used for example to force animations to restart.
Returns:
Returns true if the new visibility is different than its previous state.

Reimplemented from gaia::graphics::DrawerContainer.

void gaia::graphics::AnimationDrawer::start ( )

Starts the animation, looping if necessary.

This method has no effect if the animation is running.

See also:
isRunning()
stop()
void gaia::graphics::AnimationDrawer::stop ( )

Stops the animation.

This method has no effect if the animation is not running.

See also:
isRunning()
start()
